com.github.dm.jrt.android

Class LoaderBuilderCompat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.android.LoaderBuilderCompat

  • public class LoaderBuilderCompat
extends Object
    Context based builder of loader routine builders.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 03/06/2016.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • classOfType

        @NotNull
public LoaderAutoProxyRoutineBuilder classOfType(@NotNull
                                                          Class<?> targetClass)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the builder context, wrapping the specified target class.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        targetClass - the invocation target class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • instanceOf

        @NotNull
public LoaderAutoProxyRoutineBuilder instanceOf(@NotNull
                                                         Class<?> targetClass)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the builder context, wrapping the specified target object.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        targetClass - the class of the invocation target.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • instanceOf

        @NotNull
public LoaderAutoProxyRoutineBuilder instanceOf(@NotNull
                                                         Class<?> targetClass,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         Object... factoryArgs)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the builder context, wrapping the specified target object.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        targetClass - the class of the invocation target.
        factoryArgs - the object factory arguments.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                                         Class<? extends Invocation<IN,OUT>> invocationClass)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified class.
        The method accepts also classes implementing ContextInvocation.

        Note that inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationClass - the invocation class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no default construct is found.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                                         Class<? extends Invocation<IN,OUT>> invocationClass,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         Object... args)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified class by passing the specified arguments to the class constructor.
        The method accepts also classes implementing ContextInvocation.

        Note that inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationClass - the invocation class.
        args - the invocation constructor arguments.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no construct constructor taking the specified objects as parameters is found.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                                         ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factory)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the builder context.
        In order to prevent undesired leaks, the class of the specified factory must have a static scope.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.
        Note also that the input data passed to the invocation channel will be cached, and the results will be produced only after the invocation channel is closed, so be sure to avoid streaming inputs in order to prevent starvation or out of memory errors.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        factory - the invocation factory.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified factory has not a static scope.

      • on

        @NotNull
public LoaderAutoProxyRoutineBuilder on(@NotNull
                                                 ContextInvocationTarget<?> target)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the builder context, wrapping the specified target object.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        target - the invocation target.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                                         InvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factory)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the builder context.
        In order to prevent undesired leaks, the class of the specified factory must have a static scope.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.
        Note also that the input data passed to the invocation channel will be cached, and the results will be produced only after the invocation channel is closed, so be sure to avoid streaming inputs in order to prevent starvation or out of memory errors.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        factory - the invocation factory.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified factory has not a static scope.

      • onId

        @NotNull
public LoaderChannelBuilder onId(int loaderId)
        Returns a builder of output channels bound to the loader identified by the specified ID.
        If no invocation with the specified ID is running at the time of the channel creation, the output will be aborted with a MissingLoaderException.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        loaderId - the loader ID.
        Returns:
        the channel builder instance.
